commits.message: Update the bridge helper functions site
Fix project size calculation for JavaScript type-checking in SonarLint context (#4317)
Fix project size calculation for JavaScript type-checking in SonarLint context (#4317)

issue.title: Fix project size calculation for JavaScript type-checking in SonarLint context

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Exceptions and blocking issues during analysis

issue.body:
For performance reasons, the type-checking of JavaScript files in SonarLint context is limited according to the project size, that is, the number of files supposed to be analyzed. However, it currently does not rely on the [file-filtering logic of the analyzer](https://github.com/SonarSource/SonarJS/blob/master/sonar-plugin/sonar-javascript-plugin/src/main/java/org/sonar/plugins/javascript/filter/JavaScriptExclusionsFileFilter.java). As a result, files from `node_modules` (among other things) are incorrectly included in the counting.

Reported in https://discuss.sonarsource.com/t/sonarlint-not-showing-javascript-issues-when-certain-dependancies-are-included/15800

commits.message: Update the bridge helper functions site
Ignore file size limits for CSS (#4316)

issue.title: Fix confusion over `sonar.javascript.maxFileSize` being applied on CSS files
issue.body:
The `sonar.javascript.maxFileSize` option is applied at the analyzer level for JS, TS, and CSS.

At least 1 customer was confused that his big CSS file was not analyzed until he changed the aforementioned option which is labelled for JS.

We need to investigate if the file size limit is necessary for CSS, by analyzing a big file for example.
- If yes, we introduce a dedicated option like `sonar.css.maxFileSize`
- otherwise, we don't apply this limitation for CSS files

~~We can also improve the current behaviour by logging clearly when a file is excluded from the analysis because of its size.~~

This issue was raised in https://community.sonarsource.com/t/problems-parsing-css-file/101595

commits.message: Ignore file size limits for CSS (#4316)

issue.title: Ignore file size limits for CSS

comment.body:
> I was wondering if it is problematic that the filter scope is [only covering CssLanguage here](https://github.com/SonarSource/SonarJS/pull/4316/files#diff-28dde6e2d26aa37a519a3ee653f370200e5705d1dd012a3a92e1a0631d47e828R69) contrary to how the [CSSRuleSensor filters it](https://github.com/SonarSource/SonarJS/blob/f600f32768137b1433ee6df6c16df147eba2b213/sonar-plugin/sonar-javascript-plugin/src/main/java/org/sonar/plugins/javascript/bridge/CssRuleSensor.java#L211-L226).

IMO, it's okay like this. We don't need to filter `html` or other files. We can adjust if we discover there is an issue with such setup.
